üíª Laptop Store - Java Spring MVC

üõ† Introduction

Laptop Store is a web application developed using Java Spring MVC to manage a laptop store with features such as product listing, shopping cart, order placement, and order management.

üöÄ Features

üè∑ View product list: Display laptops categorized by brand.

üîç Search and filter products: Search by name, brand, and price range.

üõí Add to cart: Users can add products to the cart and adjust quantities.

üí≥ Order placement: Support order placement with customer information.

üì¶ Order management: Users can track their order status.

üë§ User account management: Registration, login, and profile updates.

üîë Admin privileges: Admins can add/edit/delete products and manage orders.

üèó Technologies Used

Backend: Java Spring MVC, Spring Boot, Hibernate ‚öôÔ∏è

Frontend: JSP, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap üé®

Database: MySQL üóÑ

Version Control: Git, GitHub üåç

üìå Installation and Running the Project

1Ô∏è‚É£ Clone the repository

$ git clone https://github.com/AnhDat0103/Laptop-Store-Java-Spring-MVC.git
$ cd Laptop-Store-Java-Spring-MVC

2Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the Database

üóÑ Create a MySQL database named laptop_store.

üì• Import the laptop_store.sql file from the database folder into MySQL.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Run the Application

üõ† Open the project in an IDE (Eclipse/IntelliJ).

‚öôÔ∏è Configure application.properties to connect to the database.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Run the Spring Boot application.

üåê Access http://localhost:8080 to use the application.
